Description of incident: Seagate notified current and former employees of a data breach, when an employee feel for a phishing attack that exposed W2 information of employees."Email scam artists last week tricked an employee at data storage giant Seagate Technology into giving away W-2 tax documents on all current and past employees, KrebsOnSecurity has learned. W-2 forms contain employee Social Security numbers, salaries and other personal data, and are highly prized by thieves involved in filing phony tax refund requests with the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) and the states."The information compromised includes all information found on a W2 form, which includes Social Security numbers. The company is not saying exactly how many individuals were affected at this time, only that “It’s accurate to say several thousand.
